author: deluckybrick
title: Good for minifigs!
review:
This set really has everything you look for in town minifigs.

Construction
Police
Fire department
Regular people

The set is good for adding minifigures to your town, and the minifigures in question are good for all your town's services and streets. Goes well with Fire Chief and Construction Crew.

author: CyandraZ
title: Excellent figure pack.
review: What? A great Town Jr. set? Well, as a matter of fact this is a great set, and it could fit in perfectly with the early 1990's sets. Sure, it has 3 generic worker figures, but it also has a nice banker, a female cheif, and a good woman figure. Plus, it has lots of great acessories like a bike, cat, coins, breifcase, and even a pizza! So, this overall is a great expansion to any town, and might just be worth picking up new or used for a few dollars. 5/5

author: mrmitch
title: Gotta Love the new neighbors .
review: This set was one of my first when we started collecting LEGO's. Six people-extras like the cat and the bike, at the time it was $6.00, it was and is a great value and a needed addition to any LEGO town. LEGO would due well to re-release this set or one simular at a reasonable price. This set is a must have, great way to add everyday people to your town - 5 out 5 no doubt.

author: Pepper
title: one of my first Lego sets ever
review:
I got this a while ago for Christmas. It was one of my first sets. It has some nice things in it, not just people.

pros.
-6 minifigures
-bicycle
-pizza
-money
-other accessories

cons.
-not really any

Considering that I don't really care for town/city, this is pretty good.

author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: A Great Addition, can't miss it.
review: I think I was 5 when I got this. Everything can be seen just by looking at the box: Contrustruction worker with jack hammer, chef with pan and PIZZA, female civilian with bike, fire chief with axe, police with phone, banker with briefcase and COINS, and cat. This is the absolute perfect start the the building of any city. Minifigures have high variety, they come with accessories. What more could be perfect?!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Here Kitty, Kitty
review:
Set #6326 Town Folks: Why did I ever let this one go? I mean Mini-Figures don't take up that much storage space... Oh well. It's gone now and there's nothing I can do about it.

 

Town Folks is another Mini-Figure Collection from the Town Theme, this one includes a Firefighter, a Police Officer (as though we'd need more of them.) a female cyclist with a red bycicle, a construction worker with jackhammer, a bank security guard with suitcase and coins, a female pizza chef and a small white cat.

 

Overall this is a definite set to pick up for LEGO Town enthusiasts, the female chef and the bank security guard alone are worth the price of this set. LEGO hasn't made that many banks for LEGO Town/City. The cat is a nice touch too, an animal deserving of being owned. The bike is a nice piece that you don't see too often in modern LEGO City sets, and the jackhammer accessory for the Construction Worker is also a unique piece. If you can find this anywhere I'd say get it, I personally should not have let it slip through my fingers, but that is the way of things.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Accessories) - Town Folk Review
review:
This is a good little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 35 pieces and it was 6 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 17 cents per piece which is a really good value for what we get here

Minifigures

This set has 6 cool looking minifigs.

The firefighter has a black uniform, a white helmet, a smiley face and an axe. The police officer has a black uniform with a badge, a white helmet and black sunglasses on his face. He also comes with a walkie-walkie. We also get a construction worker who has a blue overall, a red helmet, a beard on his face and a drill. The next minifig we get is the banker. The banker has a gray vest with a badge, green arms, black pants, a white hat and black sunglasses on his face. He also has a suitcase with some money. This set also includes a female biker. The lady has a white shirt, green pants, brown hair and she also has a red bike. The last minifig we get is the female cook. The cook comes with a white hat, a white jacket, red pants and a pan with a pizza on it. We also get a cat with this set.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to complain about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6326-1.jpg[/img]

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Wipipi
title: Great for filling up any Classic Towns!
review:
This Lego Set is an amazing way to fill up your town with every day citizens! If you get all the citizen packs, such as some of the ones from the 80's, your town will be booming with life! From a construction worker to a biker, children can have a lot of fun with all the characters, from making them have a normal life to writing them a back story, kids can have many different ways to discover a play style that fits them!

Now here are some pros and cons.

-Pros

-Easy to fill your town with life!

-Have simple townsfolk that you can easily build in about 5 minutes!

-Cons

-No builds. If a child doesn't have anywhere to put them, such as a base plate, they could get easily lost.

-No where to put the bankers money! This is probably my biggest complaint, since I have to just put his money on the floor. This actually resulted me in losing one of his coins somewhere on a shelf while I was relocating the set. 

In conclusion, this is a great set if you are looking to add to a town, specifically a vintage town. It just gives it a more "alive" effect. I am looking forward to getting more sets like this to fill up my classic town!
